title: Police identify women killed in Tuesday apartment complex shooting
content:
Killeen police spokeswoman Carroll Smith said Kysha D. Edmond-Gray, 42, and Deanna Louise Buster, 38, both of Killeen, were killed in the 400 block of Gilmer Street.
Smith said officers responded to the Village West Apartments at 3:22 a.m. Tuesday after receiving several 911 calls of shots fired. When officers arrived, they found Edmond-Gray and Buster, who were pronounced dead at the scene, and three others with gunshot wounds.
Smith said two men and a woman were transported to Metroplex Hospital and Baylor Scott & White Hospital where they remain in stable condition. She said their names are being withheld.
Smith said police continue to search for the alleged shooter, Rico Doyle, 35, of Killeen. She said Doyle is considered armed and dangerous.
An arrest warrant was issued charging Doyle with murder Tuesday afternoon.
Police are asking anyone who knows Doyle's whereabouts to call Crime Stoppers at 254-526-8477 or go to www.bellcountycrimestoppers.com.
Contact Natalie Stewart at nstewart@kdhnews.com or 254-501-7555
